Viral Sopir Kontainer Dipalak di Tanjung Priok, Polisi: Kami Tindak Tegas
01 Nov 2019, 03:32 by Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta - Video sopir truk kontainer dipalak di Pelabuhan Tanjung Priok, Jakarta Utara (Jakut). Polisi menyatakan tidak tinggal diam atas pemalakan tersebut.
"Kita terus bekerja sama dengan Polres Jakarta Utara, untuk melakukan imbauan-imbauan untuk tidak melakukan pungutan kepada para sopir-sopir truk tersebut. Kami tidak sungkan-sungkan akan melakukan tindakan tegas dalam penegakan hukum kepada mereka," kata Kapolres Pelabuhan Tanjung Priok, AKBP Reynold EP Hutagalung, saat dimintai konfirmasi, Kamis (31/10/2019).
Reynold mengatakan Polres Pelabuhan Tanjung Priok bersama Polres Jakut terus melakukan patroli rutin. Kerja sama ini dilakukan karena tindakan pungutan liar (pungli) meresahkan masyarakat.
Dia mengatakan kadang anak di bawah umur ikut memalak sopir truk. Namun, saat ini dia mengatakan polisi terus siaga untuk mencegah pemalakan.
"(Sekarang) sudah tidak ada. Kami terus melakukan upaya mulai dari preemtif dengan imbauan-imbauan dan melakukan preventif dengan kehadiran polisi patroli saat kapal sandar," ucapnya.

Viral Container Driver Dipalak in Tanjung Priok, Police: We Act Decisively
01 Nov 2019, 03:32 by Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta - Video of a container truck driver being barked at the Port of Tanjung Priok, North Jakarta (North Jakarta). Police said they did not remain silent over the logging.
"We continue to work closely with North Jakarta Police, to make appeals not to levy the truck drivers. We are not reluctant to take decisive action in law enforcement against them," said Tanjung Priok Port Police Chief, AKBP Reynold EP Hutagalung, when asked for confirmation, Thursday (10/31/2019).
Reynold said that Tanjung Priok Port Police along with North Jakarta Police continue to conduct routine patrols. This collaboration was carried out because the act of extortion (illegal payments) disturbed the community.
He said sometimes underage children yelled at truck drivers. However, at this time he said the police were constantly alert to prevent the logging.
"(Now) is gone. We continue to make efforts starting from the preemtive with appeals and preventive by the presence of patrol police when the ship docked," he said.
